msDesc.head: Composite manuscript: prognostication, astronomy, medicine, etc., in Latin, Middle English and French; England (?), 13th-15th centuries

history.provenance: Bequeathed by him to the Ashmolean Museum.
Transferred to the Bodleian Library in 1860.

recordHist.source: Description adapted (Dec. 2022) from the Quarto Catalogue (W. H. Black, A descriptive, analytical, and critical catalogue of the manuscripts bequeathed unto the University of Oxford by Elias Ashmole Esq...., Quarto Catalogues X, 1845), with additional reference to published literature as cited. Quarto Catalogue, cols. 239–40 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 241–2 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 243–4 Quarto Catalogue, col. 245 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1117 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1125 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1151

ref.title: JONAS: Répertoire des textes et des manuscrits médiévaux d'oc et d'oïl
MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain

msItem.title: Via ad Terram Sanctam
msItem.incipit: Porce que le Reaume de Jerl’m est apeles le Reaume qui est Rois des Rois
msItem.explicit: De Quiriacos au Caire, quatre liues de bon chemin
msItem.bibl: Jacques Paviot, Projets de croisade (v. 1290-v. 1330), Documents relatifs à l'histoire des croisades, 20 (Paris, Académie des Inscriptions et Belles Lettres, 2008), pp. 171-181 (with discussion, pp. 19-22).

msItem.author: Bernardus Silvestris (?)
msItem.title: Experimentarius
msItem.incipit: De vita quid erit dic
msItem.explicit: vade et quere a sedente super orientalem faciem turris saturni
msItem.note: With these words begin the four directory tables, written on 2 leaves which have been cut through, and were nearly loose: the next leaf, which contained Almazene and Anatha, the two first of the 28 Judges, is lost; cf. MS. Ashmole 304. Each page is superscribed with its number in Arabic figures: the handwriting is of the time of Edw. I. or II., closer than, and not so fair and bright as that of the following 7 leaves.
msItem.bibl: C. S. F. Burnett, 'What is the "Experimentarius" of Bernardus Silvestris?', Archives d'histoire doctrinale et littéraire du Moyen Age, . 44 (1977), 79-125, listed p. 101, MS. G

msItem.title: Prognostication by the moon (lunary)
msItem.rubric: De lune numero et sompnii eventu
msItem.incipit: Luna prima. omnibus agentibus utilis est

msItem.title: Phlebotomy
msItem.incipit: Quando vena aperienda sit cave tibi. v. lunam

msItem.title: Prognostication by the moon (lunary)
msItem.incipit: La prime lune est bone a comencer totes choses

msItem.title: Prognostication according to the day on which Christmas and New Year fall
msItem.incipit: Mestre Joe vus requer que del jur de Noel les aventurs et les secree me diet
Mestre des calendes de Jeniver voderay ioe oyer la difiniciuns volunters dist e lucidara

msItem.note: Three verses:
msItem.incipit:
In septem stabis. minus yma petens numerabis
Post septem sursum numerando perfice cursum.
Sicque novem tractus numerus dat quod petit actus.
msItem.note: Also on fol. 7v with the same rubric as art. 2
The tracts on ff. 30-49, were written in the scholastic text hand, early in the XIVth century.

msItem.title: Sortes Albedaci
msItem.incipit: Dilecto regi Persarum vates Albedacus salutes majores
msItem.note: Thus begins the prologue. The tables consist of 30 oriental words, each heading 12 short sentences: the first is Gosal.

msItem.title: Sortes Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: Sortes medibus decijs. Deus miseriatur nostri. Deus in adjutorium meum.
msItem.note: The prayer prefixed calls this article 'has sortes apostolorum tuorum': it consists of triple combinations of the numbers 6 to 1, with a prognostication on each. The 3 next pages are blank.

msItem.title: Liber Amblaudii et Hermetis
msItem.note: (tr. Hugh of Santalla)
msItem.incipit: Refert Ablaudius Babilonius inter antiquissima Grecorum volumina cartam vetustissimam in qua de spatule agritōne non nulla continebantur praecepta apud Athenas se invenisse
msItem.explicit: ad notarum quidem numerum adversariorum deprehenditur multitude.
msItem.note: On the margin against the end of this and the beginning of the next tract, is the following difficult note. “Hic est tractatus quoniam in eadem pariter contingit reperiri. non tamen arbissi philosophi ord’ inter Babilonios in hoc negocio precellebat ascriptum liber abdalaben zeleman de spatula hugonis translatio et de ipso negocio tanquam experta descripsit.”

msItem.title: Liber Abdalaben Zeleman de spatula
msItem.note: (tr. Hugh of Santalla)
msItem.incipit: Quicunque alicujus discipline instituta subtili discrecione prudenti et studiosa rerum investigacione
msItem.explicit: In terda rex hoslium morte afficitur.
msItem.note: At f. 43 is a chasm of two thirds of a page in the text.
msItem.bibl: ed. CCCM 144 C (Hermes Latinus 4, 4); also Textes médiévaux de scapulomancie, Textes littéraires du Moyen Âge, nº 43 (2017)

msItem.note: The 4 leaves containing these 7 articles, are very closely written in a small hand resembling records of the time of Edw. I:

msItem.title: Compotus manualis
msItem.rubric: Incipit Computus Manualis Mri J. de Pulcro Anno Hispano
msItem.incipit: Intencionis est in hoc opusculo artem ostendere qua ex juncturis manuum ad omne certum tempus utira certaque negotia composita per annum presentere, pro radice habitum possunt facillime inveniri
msItem.explicit: probacio hujus per ultimum principium patet

msItem.title: Cisiojanus (distich)
msItem.incipit: Januarius. Cir. ste. io. pu. vig. epiph.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.incipit: Volumus vos fratres karissimi parvam vobis admonicionem de oratione dominica facere
msItem.explicit: illuc nos vocare dignetur qui vivit ac regnat in secula. Amen.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.incipit: Septem peticiones sunt in oratione dominica sicut patet in his septem versibus. O Pater alme tuum fit nomen sanctificatum.

msItem.title: Verses on the complexions
msItem.incipit: Sanguineus. Largus amans. hilaris
msItem.note: Four distichs.

msItem.title: Verses
msItem.note: Vis esse incolumem
Five verses.
Excerpts from Augustine and Ambrose.
msItem.incipit: Quinque sunt digiti Diaboli primus est pudor confessionis

history.provenance: At the foot of f. 51, the name “Thomas de boccomio” is written invertedly, and at the foot of the last page is the name “penham.”

msItem.rubric: Tabula conjunccionum mediarum in annis expansis
msItem.note: This table is for the anni Christi inperfecti 1346-1424; in the first of which years it was written. With rule beginning:
msItem.incipit: Ad habendum tempus conjunctionis medie

msItem.rubric: Tabula conjunccionum mediarum in mensibus Christi
Tabula oppositionum mediarum in mensibus Christi

msItem.note: Table for lunar motion for a 15 day period
Diagrams
msItem.rubric: Figura solis, figura lune, figura draconis, figura. 3. superiorum planetarum et veneris, figura retrogradacionis, figura mercurii

msItem.note: Verses on conjunctions and aspects
msItem.incipit: Si planete duo signo junguntur in uno

msItem.rubric: Tabula equacionis domorum in latitudine. 51. graduum et 40. minutorum
Tabula lune in annis expansis et collectis

msItem.note: With rule.

msItem.rubric: Tabula medii motus lune cum argumento ad extrahendum verum locum lune quolibet die

msItem.note: This table is written in a hand more ancient than the rest, and the third leaf of it is lost.

The names of 14 tracts anciently contained in this MS. are here written by the same hand: of these, the only articles now existing, are those numbered 16, 18, and 22 in the following analysis: the smaller pieces are not mentioned in this list.

msItem.title: On gentian
msItem.incipit: Basilica herba .i. genciana
Balsamus et unda cera cum crismatem unda Conficiunt agnum
msItem.note: (36 v.) . These occupy a page and a half, written in the XVth century.

msItem.title: Glossary
msItem.note: Twelve English verbs, with the corresponding French and Latin words: thus -
msItem.incipit: Spewen. vomer. Nauseo

msItem.note: Verses: three distichs
msItem.incipit: Est arbor vitis
Lis leprosorum
Pater scire vellem

msItem.note: Commentaries on 'Minus scio quod per confessionem scio' by “Fr. K. de Lincoln” et fr. Martin of Lenne (Lynn).
msItem.incipit: Minus scio quod per confessionem scio
Ubicunque est actus moralis et delectacio morosa
Nota quod consensus semiplenus dicitur
Nota quod differt sensualitas a sensibilitate

msItem.title: Prognostication by thunder (in verse)
msItem.incipit:
Accedens quicunque cupis cognoscere verba
Lucida laudanda vera probata bona.
Anno quocunque signo tonitrus tonat, illud
Quod tonat est verum nocte dieque tonans

msItem.note: Preceded by mnemonic verse on the Zodiac:
msItem.incipit:
Est aries, taurus, gemini, cancer, leo, virgo
Libraque, scorpio, architenens, caper, urnaque pisses.

msItem.title: On tithes
msItem.incipit: Nota quod quadrupliciter remuneratur a Deo qui fideliter dat decimas

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: De praecepto et dispensatione (extract: c. 12)
msItem.incipit: Si ex contemptu sciens et deliberans sponte in verba prorupero

msItem.title: Extracts from monastic rules (on accidents at the Mass, obedience, etc.)

msItem.incipit: Cum de corpore vel sanguine Domini tanta negligencia aliquo casu accidit ut cadat deorsum
Si aperta quod absit negligencia de corpore Domini
Si forte alicui fratri contigerit
Nota hec sunt que Monachus debet prelato suo

msItem.title: Note on the interpretation of scripture
msItem.incipit: Exponitur sacra scriptura. 3r. Allegorice
msItem.note: Etc. The following articles are contained in the other transposed part of this MS.

msItem.title: Rules for converting Christian to Islamic calendar
msItem.note: It seems to have been the sequel of the 'Tabula ad inveniendum annos Arabum', which is the fifth title in the list at f. 85. Only the last 12 lines are preserved, ending:

msItem.incipit: Quando vis scire locum solis subtrahe quaternarium ab annis Christi quociens poteris

msItem.title: Astronomical tables
msItem.rubric: Tabula prima solis post annum bisextilem
msItem.note: Four tables. They are called in the list of contents 'Tabule per quas scitur gradus solis in quolibet signo'.

msItem.title: Qualities of the signs of the Zodiac
msItem.incipit: Aries est signum mobile calide et sicce nature
msItem.explicit: Nota quod ubicunque dicitur bonum est vel cavendum est. intelligitur dum luna fuerit in illo signo. Explicit.”

msItem.title: Rules for converting Christian to Islamic calendar
msItem.rubric: Scientia ad inveniendum annos Arabum per annos Christi per multiplicationem et divisionem secundum Ptolomeum
msItem.incipit: Si autem annos Arabum

msItem.title: Rules for converting Christian to Islamic calendar
msItem.rubric: Scientia annorum Arabum per annos Christi per multiplicationem et divisionem secundum Arzechelem
msItem.incipit: Accipe annos Christi perfectos

msItem.author: Campanus of Novara
msItem.title: De quadrante
msItem.incipit: Scire debes quod circulus solis duas habet medietates
msItem.explicit: Hec quoque de practica quadrantis dicta sufficiant

supportDesc.extent: 26 leaves, a small part of its original quantity. Of these, ff. 69, 82-4, 93-4, are blank vellum; and the remaining portions, ff. 85-92, 70-81, have been transposed. They are here described in their proper order.

history.provenance: Fols. 69-94: Bermondsey, Surrey, Cluniac priory and (from 1399) abbey of St Saviour: 'Libellus dompni Iohannis ..d... monachi sancti saluatoris de Berdmondsi iuxta London'' (fol. 85r, at top, s. xv, legible by u-v light). (MLGB3: evidence from an inscription of ownership by an individual member of a religious house (which may not, however, be evidence for institutional ownership)).

msItem.title: Ecclesiastical and astronomical calendar.
msItem.note: 18 Apr. “Ao. domini Mo. CC. xx. jactatum fuit ecclesie nove Sar. fundamentum.” (104b.)
Note on lunar cycles ending between 1463 and 1519, suggesting that the cycle wherein this calendar was written, began in 1444, and ended in 1462.
Signs of the Zodiac, their months and qualities.

msItem.rubric: Tabula planetarum ad sciendum quis planeta regnat qualibet hora
Tabula lune ad sciendum ejus signum omni die. et in quo gradu illius signi

msItem.note: The manuscript originally consisted of of 14 leaves of vellum (fols. 101-114), to which were added 7 leaves (beside others that have been cut out), on two of which was written about the time of Henry VIII:
msItem.title: A text on the qualities of the twelve signs
msItem.incipit: Januari: aquarius est hote and moyste sanguine. Aquarius is a watry sygne

msItem.title: Text on the four humours
msItem.incipit: It is to undurstand that every man is made of four elymentys

msItem.title: Lunary: of the qualities and effects of the moon’s 28 mansions
msItem.incipit: In the name of Godde for the first hous whan the mone is in the first mancōn wurch þu for life of womman, etc.

msItem.title: Cautiones
msItem.incipit: In þe moneþ of Jauere lett þe not blode

msItem.title: Bloodletting (extract from Secreta Secretorum (?))
msItem.incipit: Si volueritis flegbotomare

msItem.title: Prognostication according to thunder
msItem.rubric: De fortunis venientibus per tempora anni
msItem.incipit: Janeuere. þonder toneth grete wynd and plente of alle kyn frute and batelle þat ilke yer

msItem.title: On the four seasons
msItem.incipit: Ver incipit viijº. idus februarij

msItem.title: Bloodletting
msItem.incipit: Mense Februarij. vena pollicis est incidenda

msItem.title: Bloodletting
msItem.rubric: Isti sunt dies boni et graciosi ad fleobotomandum probati secundum magistrum Evesham phisocianum
msItem.incipit: Viz le jour de seynt Stefne

msItem.title: Bloodletting
msItem.incipit: Fleobotomi a mentem sincerat, etc

msItem.title: Perilous Mondays
msItem.incipit: These bene iij perlous monedayes in þe yere, etc. .
The best dayes of every monethe to be gyne any gode werke, etc.

msItem.title: Cautiones
msItem.incipit: Mars. Aries. Cave ab incisione

msItem.title: Distichs on the Zodiac and the planets
msItem.incipit: Est aries
Sol et mercurius

msItem.title: On the movement of the moon
msItem.incipit: Nota quod per quatuor septimanas

supportDesc.extent: 16 leaves of parchment, and 8 other leaves (fols. 130-7), the two outermost parchment, and the others paper.
supportDesc.condition: The two first leaves have been cut with the stroke whereby the third was cut out and lost.

msItem.author: Johannes de Pulchro Rivo
msItem.title: Compotus
msItem.incipit: Ad habendum ciclum solarem secundum gallendum sive litteram dominicalem quod habemus in proposito sumatur versus iste ‘Filius esto Dei celum bonus accipe gratis'
msItem.explicit: Et hec de utilioribus que considerat compotista breviter et succincte compilata ad presens dicta sufficiant

msItem.title: Cisiojanus with gloss
msItem.incipit: Cisio. Janus. epy. luci. paulus et oc. feli. marcel
msItem.note: On the following page (142b) is written an inaccurate copy of these verses by a hand of the XVth century: they may be found printed among the appendices to the edition of Johannis de Sacro Bosco Sphæra, Antv. 1582, 8vo. p. 262-3.

msItem.author: Johannes de Sacro Bosco
msItem.title: Algorismus
msItem.incipit: Omnia que a primeva rerum origine processerunt ratione numerorum formata sunt
msItem.explicit: et hoc de radicis extraccione sufficiat tam in numeris quadratis quam cubicis

msItem.title: Text on solstices
msItem.incipit: Sol aliquando stet. sed quia tunc est in maximo accessu a chenit capitis nostri

msItem.author: Alexander de Villa Dei
msItem.title: Carmen de Algorismus
msItem.incipit: Hec algorismus ars presens dicitur in qua
msItem.note: Incomplete at the end, one leaf or more having been lost between ff. 148 and 149; the next article therefore begins imperfectly.

msItem.title: Compotus metrificatus
msItem.note: The first line in this copy, is-posteriore die celebratur festa maihie
msItem.explicit: Qui sine principio fuit, est, et erit sine fine
msItem.note: Perhaps related to the Massa compoti of Alexander de Villa Dei.

msItem.title: Poem on compotus
msItem.incipit: Alphabeta duo que ter deca quinque figuris
msItem.explicit: Qua mediante potes quod queris semper habere.

msItem.title: Compotus: explicatio diversarum tabularum ecclesiasticarum, inter quas Garlandi et Dionysii
msItem.incipit: Tabula prima tabula terminorum dicitur. quoniam in ilia termini. 5. festorum mobilium inveniuntur
msItem.explicit: et semper litera tabularis erit cum qua litera dominicalis occurrit

msItem.title: Computistical table
msItem.note: A circular table showing the dominical letter in the whole cycle of the sun, corresponding with the numbers of that lunar cycle in which the year “M. CCC.” was the ninth. Compare MS. Ashmole 361, f. 128b.

msItem.title: Dominion of the signs of the Zodiac in the human body
msItem.incipit: Et sachies que chacun des xij singnes dou del a sa partie ou cors de chacun homme et femne

supportDesc.extent: 18 leaves of vellum, yellow with age; of which the last but one is cut out

history.provenance: Fol. 153, “Liber Johannis Prichard apud Chestriam ao 1649. Jo: Prichard de Prion.”

revisionDesc.change: Sebastian Dows-Miller. Corrected typo in bibl type.
